fields.description:
When we create new ebs-backed instances and in the middle of its creation we choose to terminate this instance.

Then, the instance got terminated but its allocated ebs volume will remain pending in "deleting" state.


I am using VMware ESXi 5.0 as NC.

I am talking about vol-F01D4101.


The output of euca-describe-volumes command:

VOLUME  vol-FD2040B5     10     snap-973E400B   zone-vmware-1   in-use  2012-09-10T05:20:45.443Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-FD2040B5    i-A90244B2      /dev/sda1       attached        2012-09-10T05:20:45.561Z

VOLUME  vol-F01D4101     10     snap-A9EB3F7B   zone-vmware-1   deleting        2012-09-13T10:12:45.926Z

VOLUME  vol-2F894189     10     snap-A9EB3F7B   zone-vmware-1   in-use  2012-09-13T10:19:03.311Z
ATTACHMENT      vol-2F894189    i-6F953F92      /dev/sda1       attached        2012-09-13T10:19:04.073Z




cloud-output.log has one line only:

Thu Sep 13 15:42:48 2012  INFO OverlayManager          | losetup /dev/loop4 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-F01D4101



cloud-error.log don't have any records


cloud-debug.log also has one line,

Thu Sep 13 15:42:48 2012  INFO [OverlayManager:pool-32-thread-3] [com.eucalyptus.storage.OverlayManager.losetup(OverlayManager.java):255] losetup /dev/loop4 //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-F01D4101
fields.summary: Terminating the ebs-backed instance in the middle of its creation doesn't delete its ebs volume

comments.body:
Hi Narender,

I gave this a shot on ubuntu precise with KVM hypervisor and running Eucalyptus 3.1.1, I terminated the instance after few seconds of starting it, and found that the instance got terminated but the volume was shown as 'deleting' when I did euca-describe-volumes

1. Run an instance from EBS backed EMI

{code}
# euca-run-instances -k sshlogin -t m1.large emi-5562433F
RESERVATION	r-97024170	894843495874	default
INSTANCE	i-5C4E408C	emi-5562433F	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	pending	sshlogin	0		m1.large	2012-09-18T11:11:17.928Z	cloud3	eki-07A13760			monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs
{code}

2. Check the volumes

{code}
# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-05EB3CD6	 15	snap-E521425F	cloud3	in-use	2012-09-18T11:11:18.019Z
ATTACHMENT	vol-05EB3CD6	i-5C4E408C	/dev/sda1	attached	2012-09-18T11:11:18.101Z
VOLUME	vol-EA5A42CE	 15		cloud3	available	2012-09-18T10:30:18.185Z
{code}

The volume getting created is vol-05EB3CD6 from snap-E521425F

3. Terminate the instance

{code}
# euca-terminate-instances i-5C4E408C

INSTANCE	i-5C4E408C
{code}

The above command took some time before it got completed and the instance got terminated finally.

{code}
# euca-describe-instances 
RESERVATION	r-97024170	894843495874
INSTANCE	i-5C4E408C	emi-5562433F	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0	terminated	sshlogin	0		m1.large	2012-09-18T11:11:17.928Zcloud3	eki-07A13760			monitoring-disabled	0.0.0.0	0.0.0.0			ebs
{code}

4. Check the volume, whats happening there

{code}
# euca-describe-volumes 
VOLUME	vol-05EB3CD6	 15	snap-E521425F	cloud3	deleting	2012-09-18T11:11:18.019Z
VOLUME	vol-EA5A42CE	 15		cloud3	available	2012-09-18T10:30:18.185Z
{code}

It is shown in 'deleting' state

5. Check the processes running on the SC, to see if the dd operation is still going , yes it is still going on

{code}
top - 11:13:42 up  5:06,  2 users,  load average: 22.40, 13.12, 6.80
Tasks: 234 total,   1 running, 233 sleeping,   0 stopped,   0 zombie
Cpu(s):  1.2%us,  1.1%sy,  0.0%ni, 60.3%id, 37.3%wa,  0.0%hi,  0.1%si,  0.0%st
Mem:   7373964k total,  7213756k used,   160208k free,  1199348k buffers
Swap: 11354108k total,     1436k used, 11352672k free,  4869720k cached

  PID USER      PR  NI  VIRT  RES  SHR S %CPU %MEM    TIME+  COMMAND                                                                                    
 9486 eucalypt  20   0 4241m 453m  16m S    4  6.3  12:34.38 eucalyptus-clou                                                                             
12935 root       0 -20     0    0    0 D    3  0.0   0:07.83 loop1                                                                                       
  302 root      20   0     0    0    0 D    2  0.0   0:09.35 jbd2/dm-0-8                                                                                 
 1573 root      20   0     0    0    0 D    1  0.0   0:14.35 flush-252:0                                                                                 
   35 root      20   0     0    0    0 S    1  0.0   0:22.88 kswapd0                                                                                     
12977 root      20   0 11180 1716  608 D    1  0.0   0:08.83 dd        
{code}

This means the volume was still getting created? I think so.

6. Wait for 10-15 minutes to see the state of the system

The dd process is now gone and the volume is still in 'deleting' state, this causes problem because then we need to delete it manually.

7. Try to delete the volume manually by issuing euca-delete-volume

{code}
# euca-delete-volume vol-05EB3CD6
VOLUME	vol-05EB3CD6
{code}

No luck, volume is still in 'deleting' state. Not sure what is required to permanently delete this volume.

So this appears to be the issue, I am going to attach the logs from CLC/SC/Walrus with this ticket, note that I was running all 3 components on 1 machine along with the CC.

Thanks again, let me know if you have any questions.

Cheers!
Deependra

Attached are the logs from CLC/SC/Walrus all one 1 machine.

Instance ID: i-5C4E408C
Volume   ID: vol-05EB3CD6
Snapshot ID: snap-E521425F

The state on the SC after all this:

{code}
# ls -l /var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 16110321664 Sep 18 11:16 vol-05EB3CD6
{code}

{code}
# losetup -a 
/dev/loop1: [fc00]:400159 (/var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/vol-05EB3CD6)
{code}

{code}
# pvdisplay

  --- Physical volume ---
  PV Name               /dev/loop1
  VG Name               vg-dUJ-tw..
  PV Size               15.00 GiB / not usable 4.00 MiB
  Allocatable           yes (but full)
  PE Size               4.00 MiB
  Total PE              3840
  Free PE               0
  Allocated PE          3840
  PV UUID               yEHHhE-gl0K-vDqk-ieKV-SjEx-WEwH-52ddtD
{code}

{code}
# vgdisplay
  --- Volume group ---
  VG Name               vg-dUJ-tw..
  System ID             
  Format                lvm2
  Metadata Areas        1
  Metadata Sequence No  2
  VG Access             read/write
  VG Status             resizable
  MAX LV                0
  Cur LV                1
  Open LV               1
  Max PV                0
  Cur PV                1
  Act PV                1
  VG Size               15.00 GiB
  PE Size               4.00 MiB
  Total PE              3840
  Alloc PE / Size       3840 / 15.00 GiB
  Free  PE / Size       0 / 0   
  VG UUID               SikL44-7BNx-1Fqs-reip-8WK8-afds-dJYeUm
{code}

{code}
# lvdisplay
  --- Logical volume ---
  LV Name                /dev/vg-dUJ-tw../lv-XvwCpA..
  VG Name                vg-dUJ-tw..
  LV UUID                NF5IF7-oqHR-pTfX-cfPW-828M-S1fV-6CQS31
  LV Write Access        read/write
  LV Status              available
  # open                 1
  LV Size                15.00 GiB
  Current LE             3840
  Segments               1
  Allocation             inherit
  Read ahead sectors     auto
  - currently set to     256
  Block device           252:3
{code}

{code}
# tgt-admin -s 
Target 3: iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.cloud3:store3
    System information:
        Driver: iscsi
        State: ready
    I_T nexus information:
    LUN information:
        LUN: 0
            Type: controller
            SCSI ID: IET     00030000
            SCSI SN: beaf30
            Size: 0 MB, Block size: 1
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: null
            Backing store path: None
            Backing store flags: 
        LUN: 1
            Type: disk
            SCSI ID: IET     00030001
            SCSI SN: beaf31
            Size: 16106 MB, Block size: 512
            Online: Yes
            Removable media: No
            Readonly: No
            Backing store type: rdwr
            Backing store path: /dev/vg-dUJ-tw../lv-XvwCpA..
            Backing store flags: 
    Account information:
        eucalyptus
    ACL information:
        ALL
{code}

In the database it shown as 'available'

{code}
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |       create_time       | sc_name | size |  snapshot_id  |  status   | volume_user_name | volume_name  | zone 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+-------------------------+---------+------+---------------+-----------+------------------+--------------+------
 ff80818139d89e610139d8edab7500eb | 2012-09-18 10:30:18.229 | 2012-09-18 10:30:19.164 | b19893de-7fc2-4643-bbc0-35a21654462c |       1 | 2012-09-18 10:30:18.229 | cloud3  |   15 |               | available |                  | vol-EA5A42CE | 
 ff80818139d89e610139d913341a0109 | 2012-09-18 11:11:18.042 | 2012-09-18 11:16:11.295 | b305ef94-d5de-423a-9ef7-685a5dac904d |       1 | 2012-09-18 11:11:18.042 | cloud3  |   15 | snap-E521425F | available |                  | vol-05EB3CD6 | 
{code}

{code}
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version | lodev_name |                lofile_name                 |   lv_name   |  pv_name   | sc_name | size | snapshot_of |  status   |   vg_name   |  volume_name  | encryptedpassword | lun |                storename                 | storeuser  | tid 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+------------+--------------------------------------------+-------------+------------+---------+------+-------------+-----------+-------------+---------------+-------------------+-----+------------------------------------------+------------+-----
 ff80818139d89e610139d8edaeef00ed | 2012-09-18 10:30:19.119 | 2012-09-18 10:30:19.119 | c1f28091-084f-421b-9864-b2bdedcd057c |       0 | /dev/loop0 |                                            | lv-sM_tlA.. | /dev/loop0 | cloud3  |   15 |             | available | vg-lgVeXA.. | vol-EA5A42CE  |                   |   1 | iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.cloud3:store1 | eucalyptus |   1
 ff80818139d89e610139d9076a4200f2 | 2012-09-18 10:58:25.474 | 2012-09-18 10:58:25.474 | dac4ad7c-1439-4cec-96d0-ec8f28c13064 |       0 |            | //var/lib/eucalyptus/volumes/snap-E521425F |             |            | cloud3  |   15 |             | available |             | snap-E521425F |                   |     |                                          |            |    
 ff80818139d89e610139d917ad79010b | 2012-09-18 11:16:11.257 | 2012-09-18 11:16:11.257 | 6621429e-fb8c-4ee6-afa3-af1e8d80c0ec |       0 | /dev/loop1 |                                            | lv-XvwCpA.. | /dev/loop1 | cloud3  |   15 |             | available | vg-dUJ-tw.. | vol-05EB3CD6  |                   |   1 | iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.cloud3:store3 | eucalyptus |   3
(3 rows)
{code}

So we have not cleaned up properly, not sure what is the complete manual process is to clean up this mess but definitely we need to clean up without user intervention.

Let me know if you have any questions

Cheers!
Deependra
Moving this to confirmed, since Deependra was able to reproduce it.

Hi Deependra,
Thanks for reproducing this problem in a better manner.

I will wait for the solution.

Regards,
Narender
This ticket relates to VMware. See https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility for latest hypervisor compatibility by version.
